intro: Pentadenia strigosa, commonly known as the roughstemmed pentadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has rough, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Pentadenia strigosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
